header.title: Introduction
header.content:
Lidar API architecture

Based on simple REST principles, the Lidar API is organized around 5 categories of actions:

  • Authentication : Connection management.
  • Data : Wind and aerosols data retrieval.
  • Monitoring : Lidar's monitoring through status , activities environmental data and logs retrieval.
  • Configuration : scans, settings and resolution management.
  • Control : Lidar's acquisition control and programming.

The Lidar API is based on REST principles. Data resources are accessed via standard HTTP requests in UTF-8 encoding to a server hosted in the PC of the Lidar. The base address of Lidar API is http://host, where “host” is your Lidar IP address. All requests to Lidar API require authentication. This is achieved by sending a valid access token in the request header. Only standard users or more have the right to use the API. Despite our efforts on creating, reviewing and validating this API and its documentation, should you notice any bug, typo error, or have any feedback, please contact our technical support team at support@vaisala.com.

Syntax generic principles

Most of the requests respond with JSON data, but some respond with binary data (files). In this documentation, all parameters in URL ending with an interrogation mark, are optional. An object is a dataset of both properties and values. It is represented in JSON by { “property1”: “value1”, “property2”:”value2”}. An object[] is an array of this kind of object, represented in JSON by [{“commonProperty”:”value1”}, {“commonProperty”:”value2”}].

HTTPS

The web server hosted by the Lidar is able to use HTTPS or unsecured HTTP. Use of HTTPS is recommended. Shall you use HTTP, we highly recommend you to use this API on protected network or behind a HTTPS protected reverse proxy, to avoid any man-in-the-middle security breach. Vaisala can in no manner be held responsible in case of loss and/or leakage of data.

Compatibility

Some version of this API may not be retro-compatible. Please ensure you are using the API version which is compatible with the WindCube Scan software suite installed on your Lidar:

Windcube Scan software suite API version Retro-compatibility version
3.1.1 1.0.0 -
20.a 1.1.0 1.0.0
20.b 1.1.0 1.0.0
20.c 1.2.0 < 1.2.0
20.e 1.2.0 < 1.2.0
20.f 1.2.0 < 1.2.0
21.a 2.1.0 None
23.a 2.2.0 2.1.0
23.b 2.2.1 2.2.0
24.b 2.3.0 2.2.1

Available requests

Group Request Type Version Status Profile
authentication authentication/login POST V2 - VIEWER
authentication authentication/refresh_token GET V2 - VIEWER
authentication authentication/update_token_validity POST V2 - EXPERT
authentication authentication/token_validity GET V2 - STANDARD
monitoring monitoring/activity/:start_time/:end_time GET V2 - STANDARD
monitoring monitoring/devices_status GET V2 - VIEWER
monitoring monitoring/devices_status/:start_time/:end_time GET V2 - STANDARD
monitoring monitoring/environmental_data/:start_time/:end_time GET V2 - STANDARD
monitoring monitoring/global_status GET V2 - VIEWER
monitoring monitoring/logs GET V2 - EXPERT
monitoring monitoring/logs/:start_time/:end_time GET V2 - EXPERT
monitoring monitoring/monitoring_file/:start_time/:end_time GET V2 - EXPERT
data data/netcdf_file/:sequence_index/:group GET V2 - STANDARD
data data/current_sequence_index GET V2 - STANDARD
data data/sequence_by_id/:sequence_index/:group/:variable? GET V2 - STANDARD
data data/last_ray/:group/:variable? GET V2 - STANDARD
data data/sequence_list/:start_time/:end_time GET V2 - STANDARD
data data/scan_history/:start_time/:end_time/:type? GET V2 - STANDARD
data data/timestamp_limits GET V2 - STANDARD
data data/netcdf_archive/:sequence_indexes/:group GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/lidar GET V2 - VIEWER
configuration configuration/resolution_list GET V2 - EXPERT
configuration configuration/scan_list GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/settings_list GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/scan_parameters/:ID? GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/settings/:ID? GET V2 MODIFIED EXPERT
configuration configuration/save_composite POST V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/save_from_scan/:id POST V2 MODIFIED STANDARD
configuration configuration/scan_file/:id GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/scan_file/:start_id/:final_id GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/resolution_file/:id GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/resolution_file/:start_id/:final_id GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/settings_file/:id GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/settings_file/:start_id/:final_id GET V2 - STANDARD
configuration configuration/new_self_signed_certificate/:domains/:duration? POST V2 - EXPERT
configuration configuration/system_information_history GET V2 - EXPERT
configuration configuration/current_program GET V2 MODIFIED STANDARD
configuration configuration/current_self_signed_certificate GET V2 - VIEWER
configuration configuration/save_settings POST V2 MODIFIED EXPERT
control control/command/:action/:start_time? POST V2 - STANDARD
control control/program/:start_time? POST V2 MODIFIED STANDARD

Data groups

To ease data retrieval and homogenize with Windforge FTP data extraction in NetCDF file format, wind and aerosols data have been grouped in few categories.

Group Available variables
radial_wind_data radial_wind_speed
radial_wind_data doppler_spectrum_width
radial_wind_data doppler_spectrum_mean_error
radial_wind_data cnr
radial_wind_data radial_wind_speed_ci
radial_wind_data radial_wind_speed_status
wind_reconstruction_data horizontal_wind_speed
wind_reconstruction_data vertical_wind_speed
wind_reconstruction_data wind_direction
wind_reconstruction_data wind_speed_ci
wind_reconstruction_data wind_speed_status
radial_beta_data relative_beta
radial_beta_data radial_wind_speed_status
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_x_max
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_y_average
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_amplitude
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_half_height_width
radial_beta_data instrumental_function_status
radial_absolute_beta_data absolute_beta
radial_absolute_beta_data radial_wind_speed_status
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_x_max
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_y_average
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_amplitude
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_half_height_width
radial_absolute_beta_data instrumental_function_status
atmospherical_structure_data atmospherical_structures_type (No data or no detection = 0 , residual layer = 20, mixed layer = 30 , unclassified cloud = 200, ice cloud = 300, water cloud = 400, unclassified aerosol = 2000, spherical aerosol = 3000, aspherical aerosol = 4000)

When a request mentions in its input parameters, group or variable like for example GET data/sequence_by_id/:sequence_index/:group/:variable? these groups and variable must be used given the examples.

Error management

Below is the list of errors that can occur:

Error code Error Detailed explanation Meaning Troubleshooting
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown given data group 'group' One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check group name
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown given field: {FIELD} One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check field name. Cf
400 parameter_not_valid This group is not available for last ray request One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown given field 'field' for group 'group' One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Start time not valid One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if time follows ISO8601 format ( YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ)
400 parameter_not_valid End time not valid One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if time follows ISO8601 format ( YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ)
400 parameter_not_valid Start time must be older than end time One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Id has not the right format. Should be an integer One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid 'action' not valid One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check documentation of the request
400 parameter_not_valid 'loop' must be an array of objects One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if "[" and "]" exists.May be null if scheduler is not
400 parameter_not_valid 'scheduler' must be an array of objects or null One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if "[" and "]" exists.
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown field 'wrongField' in loop at object #N One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check field syntax for the line number N
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown field 'wrongField' in scheduler at object #N One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check field syntax for the line number N
400 parameter_not_valid Missing field 'field' in loop at object #N One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check request's documentation
400 parameter_not_valid Missing field 'field' in scheduler at object #N One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check request's documentation
400 parameter_not_valid 'loop' must contain at least one scan One or multiple parameters are not valid. Loop must not be null.
400 parameter_not_valid Value of field 'scan_id' in loop at object #N is not in the correct format One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if scan_id or iterations are integers, positive
400 parameter_not_valid Value of field 'scan_id' in scheduler at object #N is not in the correct format One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if it's an integer, positive if the format is wrong for scan_id ,iteration or period value.Check if timestamp follows ISO8601 format or is > than present time in case start_time is wrong
400 parameter_not_valid Scan id 'X' in loop at object #N does not exist One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if scan exists in library, depolar scan are not allowed and only the latest scan are allowed
400 parameter_not_valid Scan id 'X' in scheduler at object #N does not exist One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if scan exists in library, depolar scan are not allowed and only the latest scan are allowed
400 parameter_not_valid Relative Beta option is disabled, cannot start a calibration scan One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Object #1 and object #2 in scheduler have the same start time and period One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid 'sequence_index' has not the right format. Should be an integer greater or equal to 1 One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid 'id' has not the right format. Should be an integer greater or equal to 1 One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Relative Beta option is disabled, cannot edit a Calibration scan One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Relative Beta option is disabled, cannot save a Calibration scan One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Relative Beta option is disabled, cannot be added to a composite. One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Input data must be an object not empty One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid 'parameter' cannot be changed One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Scan must not be a composite One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Scan id 'X' does not exist One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Field 'field' not allowed for this sweep mode One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Field 'field' does not follow scan rules One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check all constraints that can be applied to that field
400 parameter_not_valid Resolution with id 'X' does not exist One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid 'parent_scan_name' property is missing or its value is not a string One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid 'elementary_scan' must be an array which contains at least one elementary scan One or multiple parameters are not valid. Check if "[" and "]" exists. cf example.
400 parameter_not_valid An elementary scan must contain two properties: 'scan_id' and 'iterations' which are integers greater or equal to 1 One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Scan with id 'X' is a composite One or multiple parameters are not valid. This scan can't be modified with this request. Use configurationsave_composite instead
400 parameter_not_valid token_validity' should be an integer between 1 and 24 One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid "'XXX.XXX.XX' has not the right format. Should be an IP address or a fully qualified domain name." One or multiple parameters are not valid. check IP address and domains or if comma separates addresses
400 parameter_not_valid 'duration' has not the right format.Should be an integer between 1 and 365. One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Final Id X should be equal or greater than  start id Y One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid 'sequence_index' has not the right format. Should be an integer greater or equal to 0 One or multiple parameters are not valid.
400 parameter_not_valid Unknown given filter 'pp'. One or multiple parameters are not valid. check the filter in the URL, accepted are PPI, RHI, FIXED, DBS
401 wrong_user_name_or_pwd Client's connection refused because of wrong credentials. Check user name and password and if account is active
401 account_inactive_for_too_long the account has been locked because inactive during too much time Expert need to reactiv account.
401 token_not_valid Access token not valid.
403 no_access_right Profile used is not allowed for this request
412 connection_rejected A user is already operating the Lidar Check if someone has already taken system control
412 no_action_done State requested is the current one
412 no_action_done Lidar is already running One or multiple parameters are not valid. Stop the acquisition before

Some example of these errors related to the requests themselves are given later in the document.
